item.title: cristal add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Everybody needs his memories. They keep the wolf of insignificance from the door." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: cristal add a quote by Anthony Lukas
item.description: "All writers, I think, are to one extent or another, damaged people. Writing is our way of repairing ourselves." -- Anthony Lukas

item.title: cristal add a quote by Shirley Hazzard
item.description: "It's nervous work. The state you need to write in is the state that others are paying large sums of money to get rid of." -- Shirley Hazzard

item.title: cristal add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I don't profess to be profound; but I do lay claim to common sense." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: cristal add a quote by Elias Canetti
item.description: "All things one has forgotten scream for help in dreams." -- Elias Canetti

item.title: cristal add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Our deeds still travel with us from afar/And what we have been makes us what we are." -- George Eliot

item.title: cristal add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: cristal add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: cristal add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
cristal add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
